intro: Gnaphalium demidium, commonly known as the slender everlasting or narrowleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Gnaphalium demidium is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in dried flower arrangements.
